Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Direction

  • public final class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a cardinal direction (North, South, East, West) and provides some functions to iterate over the directions. This class is a bit of a hack to attempt to provide some sort of enumerated type functionality since Java still lacks enums from the language. The drawback on this kind of "enum" implementation is that these objects will not serialize and restore to a different JVM properly since we're depending on the actual reference value being the same for the comparison to Direction.north. (We are using the == operator for equality comparisons here) This dependency breaks when we have move between JVMs. However, for the purposes of MazeRunner and many other java programs, this is not an issue.

      Returns the direction that is 90 degrees counter-clockwise of the current direction.

      • toInt

        public int toInt()
